node.title: This is what people in NSW will need to do before they end their life if voluntary assisted dying becomes legal
node.alt: hands of an elderly woman who is lying in hospital
node.description: As NSW Parliament gets closer to voting on the Voluntary Assisted Dying Bill, this is what will have to happen before a terminally ill person can end their life if the law is passed.
node.content:
["New South Wales is the last state in Australia to consider legislation to allow voluntary assisted dying.", "Unlike in some other jurisdictions, the voluntary assisted dying bill wasn't introduced by the state\u00a0government, rather than by\u00a0independent MP Alex Greenwich.", "If voluntary assisted dying is legalised in NSW, this is what will have to happen before a terminally ill person can end their life.", "", "
Independent MP Alex Greenwich, left, introduced the bill to NSW parliament.(Facebook: Alex Greenwich\u00a0)
", "
The formal request
", "A person must start the process by making a formal request to a medical practitioner.", "The doctor can either accept or conscientiously object.", "At that time, an official request form will be lodged with the Voluntary Assisted Dying Board, which will be a new oversight body set up under this legislation.", "If the doctor accepts, they must be experienced. They have to have one year's specialist registration or 10 years' general registration.", "They will also have completed new mandatory training that will be set up to cover legal obligations, the criteria and how to identify signs of pressure or duress.", "", "
The Voluntary Assisted Dying Board will be set up under the bill to ensure the process is followed.(Supplied: Dying with Dignity NSW)
", "
The assessment process
", "An assessment will then take place for the doctor to determine whether the person meets the criteria.", "The person must be an adult who has a terminal illness that will result in death within six months.", "If the person has neurodegenerative condition the time is extended to 12 months.", "In both instances they need to be suffering from a painful condition that cannot be tolerably relieved.", "The doctor must also be satisfied that the person has the capacity to make the decision and is doing so voluntarily.", "A form is lodged with the board to alert them that the assessment is taking place and then another on the outcome as to whether the request has been approved.", "If the first doctor is satisfied that the person meets the criteria for voluntary assisted dying, then the person must go through the same assessment process with a second, independent doctor.", "The outcome of the second assessment will also be lodged with the Voluntary Assisted Dying Board.", "
The approval process
", "In the case that it's approved by the second doctor, the person must make a written request declaring their intention to end their life.", "It must be witnessed by two people and then be submitted to the board.", "A final request must be made five days later and a review done by the first doctor.", "The doctor then applies to the Voluntary Assisted Dying Board to allow access to a substance to end their patient's life.", "
Getting euthanasia drugs
", "The substance will come from a NSW Health determined list and will vary depending on the medical condition or illness.", "The person can choose to administer the substance themselves or have a health practitioner do it.", "If they choose to do it themselves, they must have a designated person to return any unused substance.", "If a health practitioner does it, then a witness must be present.", "", "
The Premier, left, and the Opposition Leader are against the legislation.(ABC News: Tim Swanston and Supplied)
", "
Vote expected this week
", "Mr Greenwich says there's been over 12 months of consultation with experts, stakeholders and parliamentarians.", "\"We were able to introduce a bill which I believe to be the strongest in Australia in terms of safeguards and robust process,\" he said on the day he introduced the bill to parliament.", "Premier Dominic Perrottet was the first government member to speak in the debate.", "He opposes the legislation and on the floor of parliament outlined his ideological objections to voluntary assisted dying.", "\"The answer to suffering is not to not offer death,\" the Premier said.", "\"But care comfort and compassion.\"", "The Opposition leader, Chris Minns is also going to vote against the legislation.", "\"I'm not convinced any legislation can prevent an individual for choosing to die in response to pressure, cohesion or duress caused by others,\" Mr Minns said.", "", "
Debate on the bill is expected to intensify ahead of the vote.(ABC News)
", "There has been about 12 hours of debate in the lower house so far and more than 60 MPs have spoken.", "There'll be more debate on the floor of parliament on Thursday, before it's set to come to a vote.", "All MPs are being allowed a conscience vote.", "It's expected to pass the lower house and if it does, the legislation will then go to an Upper House committee for review.", "The committee must be finalised by February, which will then pave the way for it to be dealt with in the Upper House when parliament resumes next year.", "The numbers are considered tight in the upper house.", "If the legislation passes, voluntary assisted dying won't come into effect for 18 months.", "", "
MPs have been allowed a conscience vote.(ABC News)
"]
